column1: So, there's just a few questions that we wanted to ask afterwards to give you different scenarios of VR. Just to clarify, you chose that school and at home. What did you think about the use of VR in both scenarios and the stories that you think could be both negative and positive?
I think it could provide a little bit more positive. So.. (it can prevent?) No. provide.
like field trips, like for less costs, which is like one of the museums or whatever. We have a VR.
Yeah. Awesome. What kind of problems might be are created for us?
Maybe vision problems? Like that screen alchohols or addiction? Maybe? Yeah.
Yeah, for sure. Who should decide which VR experiences are a good choice for children?
Probably parents, parents and school teachers.
When VR makers create VR experiences for children and families, what are some of the important things?
Maybe like a time limit, involving education instill. Activity like burning calories.
Is there anything else they want to share about your experience in VR?
Cool, awesome. Well, thank you so much for your time.
